statement: In FY 2023, the company delivered revenue of ₹225,458 crore, a growth of 17.6%.
The company has an industry-leading operating margin of 24.1%.
TCS has over 614,000 associates with 35.7% women associates.
The company is significantly investing in building AI capabilities which include products and platforms that are AI-powered.
TCS was named to FORTUNE® magazine’s list of the World’s Most Admired Companies.
TCS topped the list of 23 IT service providers ranked on customer satisfaction, scoring 83%.
Geopolitical factors such as the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, rising inflation, and volatile commodity prices have impacted the business environment.
The company faced a high attrition rate of 20.1% in FY 2023.
The company experienced a decline in net margin to 18.7%.
The company aims to achieve net zero emissions by 2030.
TCS expects to see further growth in cloud transformation revenues.
The strong pipeline replenishment gives good visibility for the medium term.
Volatile global political and economic conditions can affect demand for the company's services.
Talent scarcity can lead to poaching of employees and impact revenue growth.
Cybersecurity risks and compliance with regulations pose significant challenges.
